Test.Name: ptz6: Correct response
Test.Description: Check HOME POSITION OPERATIONS (FIXED) test when DUT return correct response. Select ptz6 node on Management tab Featers.291 in Features_2.xml

Test.Name: Incorrect fault on SetHomePosition
Test.Description: Check HOME POSITION OPERATIONS (FIXED) test when DUT return correct response. Featers.291 in Features_2.xml

ExpectedResult.TestSummary:
PTZ-5-1-2 HOME POSITION OPERATIONS (FIXED)
STEP 1 - Getting PTZ service address Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 2 - Connect to PTZ service PTZ service address: http://localhost:3246/onvif/ServicePTZ20/PtzService.asmx STEP PASSED
STEP 3 - Getting media service address Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 4 - Connect to media service Media service address: http://localhost:3246/onvif/ServiceMedia10/MediaService.asmx STEP PASSED
STEP 5 - Searching media profile with PTZ configuration for node [token = ptz6] Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 6 - Getting PTZ configuration options Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 7 - Validating PTZ profile STEP PASSED
STEP 8 - Validating PTZ configuration options STEP PASSED
STEP 9 - Going to home position for profile [token=media_profile1] Transmit done Receive done Waiting for 30 seconds for camera to come to home position. STEP PASSED
STEP 10 - Getting PTZ status Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 11 - Moving pan/tilt to (0, 1) space=http://www.onvif.org/ver10/tptz/PanTiltSpaces/PositionGenericSpace zoom to (1) space=http://www.onvif.org/ver10/tptz/ZoomSpaces/PositionGenericSpace Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 12 - Setting home position for profile [token=media_profile1] - negative test Transmit done Receive done SOAP fault returned Code: Sender Subcode: Action1 Subcode: CannotOverwriteHome1 Reason: System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapException: MESSAGE at DUT.CameraWebService.PTZ20.PtzService.StepTypeProcessing(StepType stepType, SoapException ex, Int32 timeOut) in D:\!ONVIF\DUT\Version2\DUT\CameraWebService\ServicePTZ20\PtzService.asmx.cs:line 62 at DUT.CameraWebService.PTZ20.PtzService.SetHomePosition(String ProfileToken) in D:\!ONVIF\DUT\Version2\DUT\CameraWebService\ServicePTZ20\PtzService.asmx.cs:line 270 WARNING: The SOAP FAULT returned from the DUT is not as expected: fault subcodes sequence is incorrect. Expected: env:Receiver/ter:Action/ter:CannotOverwriteHome, actual: env:Sender/ter:Action1/ter:CannotOverwriteHome1 STEP PASSED
STEP 13 - Going to home position for profile [token=media_profile1] Transmit done Receive done Waiting for 30 seconds for camera to come to home position. STEP PASSED
STEP 14 - Getting PTZ status Transmit done Receive done STEP PASSED
STEP 15 - Checking current pan/tilt and zoom position Current pan/tilt position (1,1) space=http://www.onvif.org/ver10/tptz/PanTiltSpaces/PositionGenericSpace Current zoom position (1) space=http://www.onvif.org/ver10/tptz/ZoomSpaces/PositionGenericSpace STEP PASSED
TEST PASSED

STEP 12 - Setting home position for profile [token=media_profile1] - negative test Transmit done Receive done "Receiver/Action/CannotOverwriteHome" fault is expected, but no SOAP fault returned STEP FAILED
TEST FAILED

Test.Name: Absolute and Relative Move are not supported
Test.Description: Check HOME POSITION OPERATIONS (FIXED) test when DUT doesn't support Absolute Move and Relative Move. Define features with Features.293 in Features_2.xml

Test.Name: (no Zoom): Correct response
Test.Description: Check HOME POSITION OPERATIONS (FIXED) test when DUT return correct response when Absolute Zoom is not supported. Features.294 in Features_2

Test.Name: (no PanTilt)Correct response
